title: VideoRendererElement for integration of DirectShow and Media Foundation
body:
The VideoRendererElement could provide a renderer filter (DirectShow) or a media sink (MF) or an activation object (IMFActivate). You could use that in your DirectShow filter graph or MF topology.
At the moment, the possibilities for using DirectShow/MF in a WPF application are dissatisfying: you can use a native window for video rendering (with all the airspace issues), you can use the combination of an EVR custom presenter and a D3DImage (it is awkward and uses the UI thread for updating the video image), and of course you can use MediaElement with all its limitations (video playback only).
We badly need a media framework in WPF (even Silverlight has one), so why not use the existing frameworks DirectShow and Media Foundation and just add the missing link.
